column2: ADUs become a conditional use when "a new accessory structure [is] constructed after the enactment of these Zoning Regulations, or An increase in the height or floor area of the existing dwelling [occurs]"
column4: Peacham's definition of "dwelling, multi-family" simply states "more than three families," which is taken to include buildings housing 5+ families. As in the RD, ADUs become a conditional use in the VD when "A new accessory structure [is] constructed after the enactment of these Zoning Regulations, or An increase in the height or floor area of the existing dwelling [occurs]"
column6: ADUs become a conditional use when "A new accessory structure [is] constructed after the enactment of these Zoning Regulations, or An increase in the height or floor area of the existing dwelling [occurs]"
column8: ADUs become a conditional use when "A new accessory structure [is] constructed after the enactment of these Zoning Regulations, or An increase in the height or floor area of the existing dwelling [occurs]"
column10: PUD approval required for subdivision of three or more parcels. ADUs become a conditional use when "A new accessory structure [is] constructed after the enactment of these Zoning Regulations, or An increase in the height or floor area of the existing dwelling [occurs]"
column12: Although the WH district does modify permissible uses in underlying areas, the zoning code provides no dimensional standards for single-family development in the overlay. I am guessing that dimensional standards remain unchanged in the WH district and thus all that changes is the prohibition of other uses.
